title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to Sara A. Hotchkiss, July 27, 1862
summary: Hotchkiss writes of continued skirmishes with Federal troops, an attack of cholera, his desire for food from home, and his opinions on his daughter's beginning education.
keywords: Troop Movement, Death/Casualties, Military Authority, Women, Prisons/Prisoners, Home Front, Slavery, African Americans, American Civil War
